CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs .

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| non-fullerene |
| PC71BM |
| PTATDPP |

Three material names were identified in the paragraph: "non-fullerene", "PC71BM", and "PTATDPP".

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PTATDPP |

Only "PTATDPP" is a clear and valid material name in the paragraph. The term "non-fullerene" is a category of materials, and "PC71BM" is an abbreviation that requires additional context to identify the full name of the material.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs .

Let's think step by step.

Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph presented as a Markdown table:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| VOC |
| JSC |
| FF |

Explanation:

* PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
* VOC (Open-Circuit Voltage)
* JSC (Short-Circuit Current Density)
* FF (Fill Factor)

These are all properties related to the performance of solar cells.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

After reviewing the paragraph, I have determined that all of the identified entities are related to material properties. Therefore, there are no entities to remove. Here are the valid "Property Name" entities presented as a Markdown table:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| VOC |
| JSC |
| FF |

Explanation:

* PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
* VOC (Open-Circuit Voltage)
* JSC (Short-Circuit Current Density)
* FF (Fill Factor)

These are all properties related to the performance of solar cells, specifically photovoltaic materials.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs .

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| a lower PCE |
| over 4% PCE |
| decent photovoltaic parameters |
| VOC, JSC and FF |

In the given paragraph, the "Property Value" entities refer to the photovoltaic performance metrics mentioned. These include:

1. a lower power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the non-fullerene PSC compared to the PC71BM-based device
2. over 4% PCE of the PTATDPP-based device
3. decent photovoltaic parameters of the PTATDPP-based device
4. VOC, JSC, and FF, which are specific photovoltaic parameters (open-circuit voltage, short-circuit current density, and fill factor, respectively)

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| over 4% PCE |

After removing entities that do not clearly refer to the value of a material property, the only remaining valid entity is:

1. over 4% PCE of the PTATDPP-based device

This entity refers to the power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the PTATDPP-based device, which is a material property value.
